# Edward Psaltis

Edward (Ed) McDonald Psaltis (born 7 April 1961 in Sydney) is an Australian ocean-racing skipper and yachtsman.
Early years
Psaltis was a junior sailor with the Hunters Hill Sailing Club and sailed in his first Sydney to Hobart as a 17-year-old. He was educated at Newington College (1973–1978) and the University of New South Wales.
Sailing
Psaltis won first place overall, aboard AFR Midnight Rambler, in the storm-ravaged 1998 Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race. As a sailor he has represented Australia in the Sardinia Cup and the [https://web.archive.org/web/20130728204927/http://www.syc.com.au/club-events/tp52-southern-cross-cup/ Southern Cross Cup]. Psaltis has twice been the overall winner of the  [https://web.archive.org/web/20070829055240/http://mooloolaba.cyca.com.au/editorial.asp?key=1031 Sydney–Mooloolaba Race] in the 30-footer, [https://web.archive.org/web/20070829055957/http://mooloolaba.cyca.com.au/editorial.asp?key=1253 Nuzulu] In 1999 he won the [http://www.gossail.com.au/sailing/lord-howe-island-yacht-race/ Gosford–Lord Howe Island Race] with AFR Midnight Rambler,  only the second yacht to win both the Hobart and Lord Howe Island races (Australia's only annual Category 1 ocean races). In 2000 he was voted NSW Yachtsman of the Year.
Private life
Psaltis is a self-employed accountant based in Hobart.
